results.title: The Atlantic community: introducing Denmark
results.creator_credit: Soren Melson, Ove Sevel, Nordisk Films Kompagni and North Atlantic Treaty Organization
results.brief_description: Describes the country and the people of Denmark - geographical features, historical development and achievements, economic life, occupations of the people, and social customs. Explains the role of Denmark in NATO.

results.title: The Astronomers. Eps. 4-6
results.creator_credit: Christine Z Wiser, Linda Feferman and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description: Waves of the future looks at the lives and methods of two theorists as they investigate gravity waves and propose extravagant experiments with gravity wave detectors, both here on earth and in space. “Stardust” looks at the life and death of stars, in particular how they are born in dark areas of the universe. “Prospecting for planets” concentrates on the explosion of discoveries made by the Voyager project, the search for other planetary systems and how planetary systems are formed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christine Z Wiser, Linda Feferman and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)

results.title: The Artist, the Peasant = L'artista, Il Contadino
results.creator_credit: Franco Di Chiera and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Artist Giuseppe Mercuri dreamed of emigrating to Australia with his family in the 1950’s but was refused entry on account of his Communist Party membership and only now has he been allowed entry to visit the country of his dreams. His work captures the reflective nature of the people and lifestyle of Calabria, the area in which he was born. In this film his nephew, Franco di Chiera has documented faithfully Mercuri’s life from the hardships of his youth through the years of creative achievement and finally to his long awaited trip to Australia which meant the fulfilment of a lifetime dream.

results.title: The Artist speaks: Kenneth Armitage
results.brief_description: Kenneth Armitage, the young British sculptor, discusses his work. Examples of Armitage’s work, mostly human figures; his London studio; his collection of photographs and cuttings; how an idea from a photograph is worked on through sketches to the plaster statue ready for casting.

results.title: The Art of the Japanese package
results.brief_description: This film shows some fine examples of the traditional Japanese art of packaging with natural materials. Based upon “the Art of the Japanese Package” exhibition which toured Australia in 1979-1980. Suitable for Upper Primary-Lower Secondary students.

results.title: The Art of Ping Pong
results.brief_description: The Art of Ping Pong, by Bristol based artist Jono Sandilands, utilises projection mapping of a ping pong table to record player interactions and create multimedia art installations.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

results.title: The Art of negotiating (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jeff Inman, Ian Latimer and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description: This film is designed to teach the four main phases which occur during the negotiation process in a commercial or business setting: preparation, discussion, proposals and bargaining. Through the use of a clever analogy between domestic and work situations, this film shows how all negotiations ultimately come down to a question of civilised bargaining.
